intro: Edraianthus owerinianus, commonly known as the Persian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Iran. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features slender, hairy stems. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Edraianthus owerinianus thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine settings.
